      • jsonArrayToLongList

        public static List<Long> jsonArrayToLongList(javax.json.JsonArray arr)
        Convert a json array to a list of integers. if arr is null, then an empty List instance is returned. This is more safe than JsonArray.getValuesAs() as this method has built-in type checking and will throw a ClassCastException if the type is incorrect or null.
        Parameters:
        arr - array
        Returns:
        a list
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if any element in arr is not an integer

      • jsonArrayToIntList

        public static List<Integer> jsonArrayToIntList(javax.json.JsonArray arr)
        Convert a json array to a list of integers. if arr is null, then an empty List instance is returned. This is more safe than JsonArray.getValuesAs() as this method has built-in type checking and will throw a ClassCastException if the type is incorrect or null.
        Parameters:
        arr - array
        Returns:
        a list
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if any element in arr is not an integer

      • jsonArrayToStringList

        public static List<String> jsonArrayToStringList(javax.json.JsonArray arr)
        Convert a json array to a list of Strings. if arr is null, then an empty List instance is returned. This is more safe than JsonArray.getValuesAs() as this method has built-in type checking and will throw a ClassCastException if the type is incorrect or null.
        Parameters:
        arr - array
        Returns:
        a list
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if any element in arr is not an string

      • jsonArrayToBooleanList

        public static List<Boolean> jsonArrayToBooleanList(javax.json.JsonArray arr)
        Convert a json array to a list of booleans. if arr is null, then an empty List instance is returned. This is more safe than JsonArray.getValuesAs() as this method has built-in type checking and will throw a ClassCastException if the type is incorrect or null.
        Parameters:
        arr - array
        Returns:
        a list
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if any element in arr is not an boolean

      • jsonArrayToJsonObjectList

        public static List<javax.json.JsonObject> jsonArrayToJsonObjectList(javax.json.JsonArray arr)
        Convert a json array to a list of JsonObject instances. if arr is null, then an empty List instance is returned. This is more safe than JsonArray.getValuesAs() as this method has built-in type checking and will throw a ClassCastException if the type is incorrect or null.
        Parameters:
        arr - array
        Returns:
        a list
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - if any element in arr is not convertable to JsonObject
